requirement_tested: User registration functionality with account creation
user_persona: A new user named Alex who wants to join the social platform.
user_goal: Alex wants to successfully create an account on the website.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Registration Page
narrative_steps.description: Alex visits the website and sees a centered registration form with fields for username, email, password, and confirm password. The background is light cyan, and the form elements are styled with cadet blue.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the registration page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The registration form is displayed with correct styling: light cyan background and cadet blue form elements.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Registration Form
narrative_steps.description: Alex fills out the registration form with valid details, focusing on each input field which highlights with a cadet blue border when selected.
narrative_steps.action: Enter valid username, email, password, and confirm password. Focus on each field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each focused field shows a cadet blue border highlight. The 'Sign Up' button becomes enabled once all fields are filled.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Registration
narrative_steps.description: After filling in the required information, Alex clicks the 'Sign Up' button to submit the form.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Sign Up' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A loading spinner appears during submission, then the system redirects Alex to the login page with a success message.

user_persona: A returning user named Taylor who has already registered.
user_goal: Taylor wants to log in to her account to access the dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Login Page
narrative_steps.description: Taylor navigates to the homepage and clicks the 'Login' button, seeing a clean login form with email and password fields against a light cyan background.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Login' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A centered login form with email and password inputs, along with 'Log In' button and links for registration and password recovery, is displayed with cadet blue styling.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Credentials
narrative_steps.description: Taylor enters her email and password into the respective fields, noting how each field gets highlighted with cadet blue when focused.
narrative_steps.action: Enter valid email and password. Focus on each input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Focused fields display a cadet blue border. The 'Log In' button becomes active.

narrative_steps.title: Authenticating
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks the 'Log In' button to proceed with authentication.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Log In' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Credentials are sent to /api/auth/login. Upon successful authentication, Taylor is redirected to the dashboard with a welcome message.

requirement_tested: Friend invitation feature allowing users to invite others to join
user_persona: An active user named Jordan who wants to invite his friend to join the platform.
user_goal: Jordan aims to send an invitation to his friend via email.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Invite Modal
narrative_steps.description: While browsing the site, Jordan finds and clicks the 'Invite Friends' option, which opens a modal dialog styled with light cyan background and cadet blue accents.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Invite Friends' option.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal dialog appears containing an email input field, a pre-filled message textarea, and 'Send Invite' and 'Cancel' buttons.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Invitation Details
narrative_steps.description: Jordan types his friend's email address and reviews the default invitation message in the modal.
narrative_steps.action: Enter friend's email address and review the default message.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Email field accepts input. Default message is visible in the textarea.

narrative_steps.title: Sending Invitation
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with the details, Jordan clicks the 'Send Invite' button to dispatch the invitation.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Send Invite' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system sends a POST request to /api/user/invite. A confirmation toast appears indicating 'Invitation sent successfully!'.

requirement_tested: Content voting mechanism for user-generated posts
user_persona: A regular user named Riley who enjoys engaging with others' content.
user_goal: Riley wants to upvote a post she finds interesting.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Posts
narrative_steps.description: Riley scrolls through her feed where each post displays upvote and downvote icons next to the content, styled with cadet blue.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll through the feed to locate a post.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Posts are displayed with vote icons beside them, maintaining consistent light cyan background and cadet blue styling.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Vote Icons
narrative_steps.description: Riley hovers over the upvote icon, noticing it slightly increases in size and opacity, then clicks it to cast her vote.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over the upvote icon, then click it.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: On hover, the icon enlarges and becomes more opaque. On click, a PUT request is made to /api/content/vote/{post_id}, updating the vote count instantly.

requirement_tested: Image upload capability for sharing pictures
user_persona: A photography enthusiast named Casey who loves sharing photos online.
user_goal: Casey wants to upload a new photo to share with friends.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Upload Area
narrative_steps.description: Casey navigates to the upload section and sees a dashed rectangular drop zone with an upload icon and prompt text, styled with light cyan background and cadet blue borders.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the image upload section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Upload area is displayed with proper styling: dashed rectangle, centered icon, and descriptive text about dragging or clicking to upload.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Image File
narrative_steps.description: Casey clicks the upload area, selects a .jpg file smaller than 5MB from her device, and previews it before uploading.
narrative_steps.action: Click the upload area and select a valid image file.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Native file browser opens. After selecting a valid image, a preview of the file appears.

narrative_steps.title: Uploading Image
narrative_steps.description: Once satisfied with the preview, Casey proceeds to upload the image.
narrative_steps.action: Confirm and upload the selected image.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Image is uploaded via POST /api/media/upload. Success message confirms upload completion and the image is now available for sharing.

user_persona: An engaged user named Morgan who tracks her activity rewards.
user_goal: Morgan wants to see her updated point balance after participating in platform activities.

narrative_steps.title: Performing Activity
narrative_steps.description: Morgan uploads an image and receives points for doing so. She expects to see this reflected in her points display.
narrative_steps.action: Complete an eligible activity like uploading an image.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Backend records the activity and awards points accordingly based on the defined mapping.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Points Display
narrative_steps.description: Morgan looks at the top navigation bar where a badge indicates her current points total, featuring a star-shaped icon.
narrative_steps.action: Refresh the page or wait for live update.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Points badge in the navbar updates dynamically to reflect Morgan's new point total.

requirement_tested: Personal homepage displaying user profile information and updates
user_persona: A curious user named Devon who likes to keep track of his profile and recent activity.
user_goal: Devon wants to view his personal profile page with updated information and recent activity.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Personal Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Devon navigates to his personal homepage, expecting to see his profile picture, bio, location, and recent activity feed.
narrative_steps.action: Visit personal homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page loads and automatically fetches user details from GET /api/user/me. Sidebar displays profile info and main panel shows recent activity.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Information
narrative_steps.description: Devon checks that his profile information matches what he previously entered and scans his recent activity list.
narrative_steps.action: Scan profile information and recent activity feed.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Profile information is accurate and up-to-date. Recent activity feed displays chronological list of uploads, votes, and interactions.

requirement_tested: Dynamic data handling through backend APIs
user_persona: A developer tester named Quinn checking if frontend uses only backend APIs.
user_goal: Quinn wants to verify that all data comes from backend endpoints and not hardcoded values.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Network Requests
narrative_steps.description: Quinn opens browser DevTools and monitors network traffic while navigating the app to ensure no static data is used.
narrative_steps.action: Open DevTools and navigate the application.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Network tab shows requests to defined RESTful endpoints such as /api/auth/register, /api/auth/login, etc., returning JSON formatted data.

requirement_tested: PostgreSQL database integration using specified environment variables
user_persona: A backend engineer named Sam verifying database connectivity.
user_goal: Sam wants to confirm that the backend connects securely to PostgreSQL using provided environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Environment Setup
narrative_steps.description: Sam inspects the backend configuration to ensure it reads the correct database environment variables.
narrative_steps.action: Check backend initialization scripts and environment variable usage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Initialization script correctly configures database pool connection using DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Database Models
narrative_steps.description: Sam ensures that application models correspond properly to database tables like users, posts, media, etc.
narrative_steps.action: Verify ORM model mappings to database schema.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Models accurately represent database structures with appropriate relationships and constraints.

requirement_tested: Frontend styled with light cyan background and cadet blue components
user_persona: A UI designer named Robin auditing visual consistency.
user_goal: Robin wants to validate that the entire site follows the specified color palette.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Global Styles
narrative_steps.description: Robin examines the global CSS variables to ensure they define the correct light cyan and cadet blue colors.
narrative_steps.action: Review :root CSS variables in stylesheets.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: CSS defines --bg-color as #E0FFFF and --primary-color as #5F9EA0, matching the design specification.

narrative_steps.title: Validating Component Styling
narrative_steps.description: Robin navigates through various pages to check that backgrounds and components use the correct colors.
narrative_steps.action: Browse multiple sections of the website.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All backgrounds are light cyan (#E0FFFF), and primary interactive elements (buttons, headers) are cadet blue (#5F9EA0).

requirement_tested: Responsive UI design for social media interactions
user_persona: A mobile user named Pat accessing the site on a smartphone.
user_goal: Pat wants to comfortably navigate and interact with the site on a small screen.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Site on Mobile
narrative_steps.description: Pat opens the website on his phone and observes how the layout adapts to fit the narrow viewport.
narrative_steps.action: Load the website on a mobile device or simulate mobile resolution.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Navigation collapses into a hamburger menu. Layout adjusts to flexible grid, fonts scale appropriately, and content remains accessible.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting Responsively
narrative_steps.description: Pat tries scrolling, tapping buttons, and viewing posts to test responsiveness and touch interaction.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll, tap buttons, and view posts.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Site responds smoothly to gestures, buttons are tappable, and content reflows well without clipping or overflow issues.

requirement_tested: User feed displaying shared content from friends
user_persona: A social media user named Lee wanting to catch up on friends' posts.
user_goal: Lee wants to scroll through a personalized feed of content from his friends.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Feed Content
narrative_steps.description: Lee goes to the main feed page and waits for content from his friends to load.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the main feed.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Feed loads chronologically with posts from connected friends, showing avatars, usernames, timestamps, and content/images.

narrative_steps.title: Infinite Scrolling
narrative_steps.description: As Lee scrolls toward the bottom of the feed, more content loads seamlessly.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the end of the current feed.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional items load automatically via GET /api/feed?page=N+1, providing smooth continuous reading experience.

requirement_tested: Friend management system (add, remove, view friends)
user_persona: A user named Kim managing her list of friends.
user_goal: Kim wants to add a new friend and remove an old one from her contacts.

narrative_steps.title: Adding a New Friend
narrative_steps.description: Kim searches for a username and clicks 'Add Friend' to initiate a connection request.
narrative_steps.action: Search for a friend by username and click 'Add Friend'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: System prompts for username/email lookup. Clicking 'Add Friend' sends a request and marks the friendship status as pending.

narrative_steps.title: Removing a Friend
narrative_steps.description: Later, Kim decides to remove someone from her friends list by clicking the 'Remove' button next to their name.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Remove' next to a friend's name.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: DELETE request is sent to /api/friends/remove/{id}. Friendship record is removed and the friend disappears from the list.

requirement_tested: Content sharing functionality beyond just images
user_persona: A versatile poster named Drew who shares different kinds of content.
user_goal: Drew wants to post both text and link-based content in addition to images.

narrative_steps.title: Creating Text Post
narrative_steps.description: Drew writes a thought in the compose box and chooses to publish it as plain text.
narrative_steps.action: Write text in the compose box and toggle content type to 'text'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Compose box accepts multiline text input. Toggling sets content type to 'text'.

narrative_steps.title: Sharing Link Content
narrative_steps.description: Next, Drew pastes a URL and attaches it to another post, choosing the 'link' content type.
narrative_steps.action: Paste a URL and toggle content type to 'link'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Preview panel appears above the text area showing the attached link. Toggling sets content type to 'link'.

narrative_steps.title: Publishing Posts
narrative_steps.description: Drew submits both posts and verifies they appear correctly in the feed.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Post' for each composed item.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both posts are submitted via POST /api/posts/create and immediately appear at the top of the feed with correct formatting.

requirement_tested: Repository configuration with npm scripts for installation and development
user_persona: A developer named Charlie setting up the project locally.
user_goal: Charlie wants to quickly install dependencies and start both frontend and backend servers.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Charlie clones the repository and runs the unified install command to set up everything.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Concurrently executes `npm install` in both client and server directories, installing all necessary packages.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: With dependencies installed, Charlie starts both development environments with one command.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Concurrently launches frontend and backend development servers, enabling simultaneous development and testing.
